Topic.Title: Would Google buy Facebook because Yahoo bought Tumblr?

Message.Msg: Actually there is a new Seeking Alpha Article you should read out this morning that discusses Google buying Facebook and why. I believe it could happen. I going to buy some FB in the morning... "just in case". Read the article, it makes sense.

Topic.Title: Would Google buy Facebook because Yahoo bought Tumblr?

Message.Msg: Hey Druggie, At the price listed in the article GOOG would have to spend $96 BILLION. Too expensive. FB was priced like a bleeding edge tech company. Within 1 year of being public they have nothing new and their website hasn't changed. Graph search underwhelmed, and FB phone is being pulled off the UK market indefinitely. The US phone costs $.99 cents and I doubt that's even working. At present FB is kind of looking like a mess. Until they are more reasonably priced FB is dead money.

Topic.Title: One month chart shows...$800 to $920...present price

Message.Msg: Well that is not a real good play considering other options. Highly risky but if bought the May 24 weekly puts when GOOG hit a short term double top around 920 you could have bought these for roughly $200 and you could have unloaded for close to 2g's Friday. Your only risk was the $200 per option and you got 10X return on the play. You sell the Jan 900's and you risk the stock breaking toward 1000 and taking massive losses. As of Friday it was trading around 52 so you were up around 30% but futures are way up and GOOG will most likely sprint back toward 900 very quickly. That was actually quite a dumb move despite being up. I'll be more impressed if you can cash in at the right time. I hate to be the bearer of bad news but you'll most likely see those trading around 80 in the morning. You shulda cashed.
HOW MANY SHARES TRADED?
Take a look at the chart to the right of this page when i type,it does not look good.
no 700 some euros..converted to USD is 877

LOL. I'm a lover, not a fighter. When Love Speaks is a compilation album that features interpretations of William Shakespeare's sonnets - some spoken, some set to music - and excerpts from his plays by famous actors and musicians, released under EMI Classics in April 2002.[2][3][4] The title comes from a speech in Love's Labour's Lost - "And when love speaks, the voice of all the gods makes Heaven drowsy with the harmony" - which is, however, not on the album.
